test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-1
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" with wrong arity.

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-2
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" with arguments set to empty sequence

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-2a
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" with one argument set to empty sequence Use fn:count to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-2b
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" with one argument set to empty sequence Use fn:count to avoid empty file.

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-3
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" with arguments set to zero length string.

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-4
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" with arguments set to same value "a".

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-5
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" with arguments set to different values "a", "b" respectively.

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-6
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" as argument to fn:not. Returns true

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-7
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" as argument to fn:not. Returns false

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-8
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" whose arguments use fn:string() for a number

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-9
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" whose arguments use fn:string() for a string.

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-10
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" with wrong argument type.

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-11
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" with wrong argument type (only second argument).

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-12
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" with arguments set to "aa" and "AA" respectively.

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-13
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" with arguments set to "aa" and lower-case("AA") respectively.

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-14
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" with arguments set to "aa" and upper-case("aa") respectively.

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-15
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" as an argument to xs:boolean.

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-16
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" as part of boolean expression ("and" and fn:true()).

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-17
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" as part of boolean expression ("and" and fn:false()).

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-18
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" as part of boolean expression ("or" and fn:true()).

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-19
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" as part of boolean expression ("or" and fn:false()).

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-20
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" as part of boolean expression involving two fn:codepoint-equal ("and" operator).

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-21
test-case.description: Evaluation of an "fn:codepoint-equal" as part of boolean expression involving two fn:codepoint-equal ("or" operator).

test-case.name: fn-codepoint-equal-22
test-case.description: Different normalization forms of the same string are not codepoint-equal

test-case.name: K2-CodepointEqual-1
test-case.description: Compare two values returned from fn:lower-case().
test-case.test: codepoint-equal(lower-case(concat("B STRING", current-time())), lower-case(concat("b string", current-time())))

test-case.name: K2-CodepointEqual-2
test-case.description: Compare two values returned from fn:upper-case().
test-case.test: codepoint-equal(upper-case(concat("B STRING", current-time())), upper-case(concat("b string", current-time())))

test-case.name: K2-CodepointEqual-3
test-case.description: Compare two non-matching values returned from fn:lower-case().
test-case.test: codepoint-equal(lower-case(concat("B STRING", current-time())), lower-case(concat("no match", current-time())))

test-case.name: K2-CodepointEqual-4
test-case.description: Compare two non-matching values returned from fn:upper-case().
test-case.test: codepoint-equal(upper-case(concat("B STRING", current-time())), upper-case(concat("no match", current-time())))

test-case.name: K2-CodepointEqual-5
test-case.description: Compare two non-matching values returned from fn:lower-case() and fn:upper-case().
test-case.test: codepoint-equal(upper-case(concat("B STRING", current-time())), lower-case(concat("no match", current-time())))

test-case.name: K2-CodepointEqual-6
test-case.description: Compare two non-matching values returned from fn:lower-case() and fn:upper-case().
test-case.test: codepoint-equal(lower-case(concat("B STRING", current-time())), upper-case(concat("no match", current-time())))

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoint-equal-001
test-case.description: test fn:codepoint-equal with empty $arg1
test-case.test: declare function local:yes-empty($arg as xs:boolean) as xs:string? { if ($arg) then 'yes' else () }; empty(fn:codepoint-equal( local:yes-empty(fn:false()), local:yes-empty(fn:true()) ) )

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoint-equal-002
test-case.description: test fn:codepoint-equal with empty $arg2
test-case.test: declare function local:yes-empty($arg as xs:boolean) as xs:string? { if ($arg) then 'yes' else () }; empty(fn:codepoint-equal( local:yes-empty(fn:true()), local:yes-empty(fn:false()) ) )

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoint-equal-003
test-case.description: test fn:codepoint-equal with non-empty arguments
test-case.test: declare function local:yes-no($arg as xs:boolean) as xs:string { if ($arg) then 'yes' else 'no' }; fn:codepoint-equal( local:yes-no(fn:true()), local:yes-no(fn:false()) ) = false()

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoint-equal-004
test-case.description: test fn:boolean on fn:codepoint-equal with empty $arg2
test-case.test: declare function local:yes-empty($arg as xs:boolean) as xs:string? { if ($arg) then 'yes' else () }; boolean(fn:codepoint-equal( local:yes-empty(fn:true()), local:yes-empty(fn:false()) ) )

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoint-equal-005
test-case.description: test fn:boolean on fn:codepoint-equal with empty $arg1
test-case.test: declare function local:yes-empty($arg as xs:boolean) as xs:string? { if ($arg) then 'yes' else () }; boolean(fn:codepoint-equal( local:yes-empty(fn:false()), local:yes-empty(fn:true()) ) )

test-case.name: cbcl-codepoint-equal-006
test-case.description: test fn:codepoint-equal evaluate to item
test-case.test: declare function local:yes-no($arg as xs:boolean) as xs:string { if ($arg) then 'yes' else 'no' }; fn:index-of( (fn:true(), fn:false()), fn:codepoint-equal( local:yes-no(fn:false()), local:yes-no(fn:true()) ) )
